info.title: Multi Geth RPC
info.description: This API lets you interact with the blockchain via JSON-RPC

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary: Gets a block for a given hash

params.name: includeTransactions
params.description: If `true` it returns the full transaction objects, if `false` only the hashes of the transactions.

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary: Gets a block for a given number

params.name: includeTransactions
params.description: If `true` it returns the full transaction objects, if `false` only the hashes of the transactions.

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of most recent block.

methods.name: eth_getStorageAt
methods.summary: Gets a storage value from a contract address, a position, and an optional blockNumber

methods.name: eth_getTransactionCount
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByHash
methods.summary: Returns the information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns the information about a transaction requested by the block hash and index of which it was mined.

params.name: index
params.description: The ordering in which a transaction is mined within its block.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns the information about a transaction requested by the block hash and index of which it was mined.

params.name: index
params.description: The ordering in which a transaction is mined within its block.

methods.name: eth_getTransactionReceipt
methods.summary: Returns the receipt information of a transaction by its hash.

result.name: transactionReceiptResult
result.description: returns either a receipt or null

methods.name: eth_getUncleByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a uncle of a block by hash and uncle index position.

params.name: index
params.description: The ordering in which a uncle is included within its block.

methods.name: eth_getUncleByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns information about a uncle of a block by hash and uncle index position.

params.name: uncleBlockNumber
params.description: The block in which the uncle was included

params.name: index
params.description: The ordering in which a uncle is included within its block.

methods.name: eth_newFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs). To check if the state has changed, call eth_getFilterChanges.

schema.description: The filter ID for use in `eth_getFilterChanges`

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives. To check if the state has changed, call eth_getFilterChanges.

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive. To check if the state has changed, call eth_getFilterChanges.

methods.name: eth_uninstallFilter
methods.summary: Uninstalls a filter with given id. Should always be called when watch is no longer needed. Additonally Filters timeout when they aren't requested with eth_getFilterChanges for a period of time.

schema.description: Whether of not the filter was successfully uninstalled

methods.name: eth_getFilterChanges
methods.summary: Polling method for a filter, which returns an array of logs which occurred since last poll.

methods.name: eth_getFilterLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching filter with given id.

methods.name: eth_getLogs
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching a given filter object.

methods.name: eth_getWork
methods.summary: Returns the hash of the current block, the seedHash, and the boundary condition to be met ('target').

methods.name: eth_submitWork
methods.summary: Used for submitting a proof-of-work solution.

result.name: solutionValid
result.description: returns true if the provided solution is valid, otherwise false.

schema.description: Whether or not the provided solution is valid

params.name: nonceExample
params.description: example of a number only used once

result.name: solutionInvalidExample
result.description: this example should return `false` as it is not a valid pow to submit

methods.name: eth_submitHashrate
methods.summary: Returns an array of all logs matching a given filter object.

schema.description: whether of not submitting went through succesfully

methods.name: eth_getProof
methods.summary: Returns the account- and storage-values of the specified account including the Merkle-proof.

params.name: address
params.description: The address of the account or contract

schema.description: The storage keys of all the storage slots being requested

items.description: A storage key is indexed from the solidity compiler by the order it is declaired. For mappings it uses the keccak of the mapping key with its position (and recursively for X-dimentional mappings)

oneOf.description: The merkle proofs of the specified account connecting them to the blockhash of the block specified

address.description: The address of the account or contract of the request

balance.description: The Ether balance of the account or contract of the request

codeHash.description: The code hash of the contract of the request (keccak(NULL) if external account)

nonce.description: The transaction count of the account or contract of the request

storageHash.description: The storage hash of the contract of the request (keccak(rlp(NULL)) if external account)

methods.name: eth_getCode
methods.summary: Returns code at a given contract address

params.name: blockNumber
params.description: A BlockNumber of which the code existed

methods.name: eth_getBalance
methods.summary: Returns Ether balance of a given or account or contract

params.name: address
params.description: The address of the acccount or contract

params.name: blockNumber
params.description: A BlockNumber at which to request the balance

methods.name: eth_sign
methods.summary: The sign method calculates an Ethereum specific signature with: sign(keccak256( '\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n' + len(message) + message))).

params.name: address
params.description: The address of the account whos signature to use.

schema.description: The signature data.

methods.name: eth_accounts
methods.summary: Returns a list of accounts owned by the client

schema.description: An array of addresses owned by the client

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: Returns the current price per gas in wei

methods.name: eth_hashrate
methods.summary: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with.

schema.description: Integer of the number of hashes per second

methods.name: eth_mining
methods.summary: Returns true if client is actively mining new blocks.

schema.description: Whether of not the client is mining

methods.name: eth_coinbase
methods.summary: Returns the client coinbase address.

schema.description: The address owned by the client that is used as default for things like the mining reward

methods.name: eth_protocolVersion
methods.summary: Returns the current ethereum protocol version.

schema.description: The current ethereum protocol version

methods.name: eth_getRawTransactionByHash
methods.summary: Returns raw transaction data of a transaction with the given hash.

methods.name: eth_getRawTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns raw transaction data of a transaction with the given hash.

params.name: index
params.description: The ordering in which a transaction is mined within its block.

methods.name: eth_getRawTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex
methods.summary: Returns raw transaction data of a transaction with the given hash.

params.name: index
params.description: The ordering in which a transaction is mined within its block.

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

result.name: blockTransactionCountByHash
result.description: The Number of total transactions in the given block

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block number.

result.name: blockTransactionCountByHash
result.description: The Number of total transactions in the given block

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash
methods.summary: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.

result.name: uncleCountResult
result.description: The Number of total uncles in the given block

methods.name: eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber
methods.summary: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block number.

oneOf.description: The Number of total uncles in the given block

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction
methods.summary: Creates new message call transaction or a contract creation, if the data field contains code.

schema.description: The transaction hash, or the zero hash if the transaction is not yet available.

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary: Creates new message call transaction or a contract creation for signed transactions.

schema.description: The transaction hash, or the zero hash if the transaction is not yet available.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary: Executes a new message call (locally) immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.

schema.description: The return value of the executed contract

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete. The transaction will not be added to the blockchain. Note that the estimate may be significantly more than the amount of gas actually used by the transaction, for a variety of reasons including EVM mechanics and node performance.

schema.description: The amount of gas used

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.

oneOf.description: An object with sync status data

startingBlock.description: Block at which the import started (will only be reset, after the sync reached his head)

currentBlock.description: The current block, same as eth_blockNumber

oneOf.description: The value `false` indicating that syncing is complete

methods.name: admin_exportChain
methods.description: Exports a blockchain into the specified file, appending to the file if data already exists in it

schema.description: `true` if exported or `false` failed

methods.name: admin_importChain
methods.description: Import full chain

schema.description: `true` if imported or `false` failed

methods.name: debug_chaindbCompact
methods.description: Compact chain DB. Does not work for memory databases

methods.name: debug_chaindbProperty
methods.description: returns leveldb properties of the chain database.

methods.name: debug_dumpBlock
methods.description: Retrieves the state that corresponds to the block number and returns a list of accounts (including storage and code)

methods.name: debug_getBadBlocks
methods.description: returns a list of the last 'bad blocks' that the client has seen on the network and returns them as a JSON list of block-hashes

methods.name: debug_getBlockRlp
methods.description: Retrieves and returns the RLP encoded block by number

methods.name: debug_getModifiedAccountsByHash
methods.description:
returns all accounts that have changed between the two blocks specified.
A change is defined as a difference in nonce, balance, code hash, or storage hash.
 With one parameter, returns the list of accounts modified in the specified block.

schema.description: accounts that have changed

methods.name: debug_getModifiedAccountsByNumber
methods.description:
returns all accounts that have changed between the two blocks specified.
 A change is defined as a difference in nonce, balance, code hash, or storage hash. 
With one parameter, returns the list of accounts modified in the specified block.

schema.description: accounts that have changed

methods.name: debug_preimage
methods.description:
preimage retrieves a cached trie node pre-image from memory. 
If it cannot be found cached, the method queries the persistent database for the content

schema.description: requested pre-image

methods.name: debug_printBlock
methods.description: PrintBlock retrieves a block and returns its pretty printed form

methods.name: debug_seedHash
methods.description: Fetches and retrieves the seed hash of the block by number

methods.name: debug_setHead
methods.description:
Sets the current head of the local chain by block number. 
Note: this is a destructive action and may severely damage your chain. Use with extreme caution.

result.name: head is set to the new block
result.description: `true` if head set or `null` if failed

methods.name: debug_standardTraceBadBlockToFile
methods.description: StandardTraceBadBlockToFile dumps the structured logs created during the execution of EVM against a block pulled from the pool of bad ones to the local file system and returns a list of files to the caller

params.name: StdTraceConfig
params.description: holds extra paramters to standard-json trace functions

schema.description: `true` if traced to file or `false` failed

methods.name: debug_standardTraceBlockToFile
methods.description:
standardTraceBlockToFile configures a new tracer which uses standard JSON output,
 and traces either a full block or an individual transaction.
 The return value will be one filename per transaction traced.

schema.description: `true` if traced to file or `false` failed

methods.name: debug_storageRangeAt
methods.description: StorageRangeAt returns the storage at the given block height and transaction index.

params.name: limit
params.description: Number of storage entries to return.

methods.name: debug_traceBadBlock
methods.description: TraceBadBlockByHash returns the structured logs created during the execution of EVM against a block pulled from the pool of bad ones and returns them as a JSON object.

methods.name: debug_traceBlock
methods.description:
Will return a full stack trace of all invoked opcodes of all transaction that were included included in this block. 
Note: the parent of this block must be present or it will fail

methods.name: debug_traceBlockByHash
methods.description: Similar to `debug_traceBlock`, accepts a block hash and will replay the block that is already present in the database.

methods.name: debug_traceBlockByNumber
methods.description: Similar to debug_traceBlock, accepts a block number and will replay the block that is already present in the database.

methods.name: debug_traceBlockFromFile
methods.description: Similar to `debug_traceBlock`, accepts a file containing the RLP of the block

methods.name: debug_traceTransaction
methods.description:
The traceTransaction debugging method will attempt to run the transaction in the exact same manner as it was executed on the network.
 It will replay any transaction that may have been executed prior to this one before it will finally attempt to execute the transaction that corresponds to the given hash.

methods.name: miner_getHashrate
methods.summary: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with.

schema.description: Integer of the number of hashes per second

methods.name: miner_setEtherbase
methods.description: In order to earn ether you must have your etherbase (or coinbase) address set. This etherbase defaults to your primary account. If you don't have an etherbase address, then geth --mine will not start up.

methods.name: miner_setExtra
methods.description: There is an option to add extra Data (32 bytes only) to your mined blocks. By convention this is interpreted as a unicode string, so you can set your short vanity tag.

params.name: extraData
params.description: . By convention this is interpreted as a unicode string, so you can set your short vanity tag.

methods.name: miner_setGasPrice
methods.description: Sets the minimum accepted gas price for the miner.

methods.name: miner_setRecommitInterval
methods.description: updates the interval for miner sealing work recommitting.

params.name: interval
params.description: interval for miner sealing work recommitting.

methods.name: miner_start
methods.description: Start starts the miner with the given number of threads. If threads is not defined, the number of workers started is equal to the number of logical CPUs that are usable by this process. If mining is already running, this method adjust the number of threads allowed to use and updates the minimum price required by the transaction pool.

methods.name: miner_stop
methods.description: Stop terminates the miner, both at the consensus engine level as well as at the block creation level.

methods.name: net_listening
methods.description: Determines if this client is listening for new network connections.

result.name: netListeningResult
result.description: `true` if listening is active or `false` if listening is not active

examples.name: netListeningTrueExample
examples.description: example of true result for net_listening

methods.name: net_peerCount
methods.description: Returns the number of peers currently connected to this client.

schema.description: Hex representation of number of connected peers

methods.name: net_version
methods.description: Returns the chain ID associated with the current network.

result.name: chainID
result.description: chain ID associated with the current network

methods.name: personal_deriveAccount
methods.description: requests a HD wallet to derive a new account, optionally pinning it for later reuse.

params.name: path
params.description: path to derive a new account

methods.name: personal_ecRecover
methods.description: returns the address associated with the private key that was used to calculate the signature in personal_sign.

methods.name: personal_importRawKey
methods.description: Imports the given unencrypted private key (hex string) into the key store, encrypting it with the passphrase.

methods.name: personal_listAccounts
methods.description: Returns all the Ethereum account addresses of all keys in the key store.

schema.description: ethereum account addresses in the key store.

methods.name: personal_listWallets
methods.description: ListWallets will return a list of wallets this node manages.

accounts.description: An array of addresses owned by the client

methods.name: personal_lockAccount
methods.description: lock the account associated with the given address when it's unlocked.

schema.description: returns true if successfully locked account

methods.name: personal_newAccount
methods.description: create a new account and returns the address for the new account.

methods.name: personal_openWallet
methods.description: OpenWallet initiates a hardware wallet opening procedure, establishing a USB connection and attempting to authenticate via the provided passphrase. Note, the method may return an extra challenge requiring a second open (e.g. the Trezor PIN matrix challenge).

methods.name: personal_sign
methods.description:
Signs data using a specific account. This data is before UTF-8 HEX decoded and enveloped as follows: `'\x19Ethereum Signed Message:
' + message.length + message`.

params.name: address
params.description: The address of the account who's signature to use.

schema.description: The signature data.

methods.name: personal_sendTransaction
methods.description: Validate the given passphrase and submit transaction.

methods.name: personal_signAndSendTransaction
methods.description: Validate the given passphrase and submit transaction.

methods.name: personal_signTransaction
methods.description: SignTransaction will create a transaction from the given arguments and tries to sign it with the key associated with args.To. If the given passwd isn't able to decrypt the key it fails. The transaction is returned in RLP-form, not broadcast to other nodes

result.name: signedTransaction
result.description: transaction returned in RLP-form. not broadcast to other nodes.

methods.name: personal_unlockAccount
methods.description: UnlockAccount will unlock the account associated with the given address with the given password for duration seconds. If duration is nil it will use a default of 300 seconds. It returns an indication if the account was unlocked.

methods.name: txpool_inspect
methods.description:
The inspect inspection property can be queried to list a textual summary of all the transactions currently pending for inclusion in the next block(s),
 as well as the ones that are being scheduled for future execution only.

methods.name: txpool_status
methods.description:
The status inspection property can be queried for the number of transactions currently pending for inclusion in the next block(s),
 as well as the ones that are being scheduled for future execution only.

LogConfig.description: Logconfig are the configuration options for the structured logger for the EVM.

limit.description: maximum length of output, but zero means unlimited

CodeResponse.description: An object containing information about the code.

info.description: An object contianing information about the code compilation.

source.description: The sorce code that was compiled

language.description: The language of the code that was compiled

compilerVersion.description: The sorce code that was compiled

abiDefinition.description: The application binary interface definitions of the code

ProofNode.description: An indiviual node used to prove a path down a merkle-patricia-tree

items.description: Object proving a relationship of a storage value to an account's storageHash.

key.description: The key used to get the storage slot in its account tree

value.description: The value of the storage slot in its account tree

ProofNodes.description: The set of node values needed to traverse a patricia merkle tree (from root to leaf) to retrieve a value

SeedHash.description: The seed hash used for the DAG.

TxPoolInspection.description:
Transaction pool inspection is an object with two fields pending and queued.
 Each of these fields are associative arrays,
 in which each entry maps an origin-address to a batch of scheduled transactions.
 These batches themselves are maps associating nonces with transactions summary strings.

TxBatch.description: Maps an origin-address to a batch of scheduled transactions

address.description: Account address to which batch of transactions relates

batch.description: Batch of transactions for current address

TxBatchEntry.description: Map associating nonces with transactions summary strings.

TxPoolStatus.description:
Transaction pool status. An object with two fields `pending` and `queued`, 
each of which is a counter representing the number of transactions in that particular state

FilterId.description: An identifier used to reference the filter.

BlockHash.description: The hex representation of the Keccak 256 of the RLP encoded block

BlockNumber.description: The hex representation of the block's height

BlockRLP.description: The hex representation of the block's RLP

StorageRange.description: allows downloading storage in chunks. debug_storageRangeAt takes parameters blockHash, txIndex, account, startKey, limit. The startKey applies to the hashed key. The returned storage values contain the preimage if available. The returned object also contains the nextKey field, which will be non-null if there are more keys after the range that was returned.

blockHash.description: BlockHash of the block in which the transaction was mined

blockNumber.description: BlockNumber of the block in which the transaction was mined

contractAddress.description: The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation, otherwise null

cumulativeGasUsed.description: The gas units used by the transaction

gasUsed.description: The total gas used by the transaction

logs.description: An array of all the logs triggered during the transaction

transactionIndex.description: An array of all the logs triggered during the transaction

postTransactionState.description: The intermediate stateRoot directly after transaction execution.

status.description: Whether or not the transaction threw an error.

BloomFilter.description: A 2048 bit bloom filter from the logs of the transaction. Each log sets 3 bits though taking the low-order 11 bits of each of the first three pairs of bytes in a Keccak 256 hash of the log's byte series

Log.description: An indexed event generated during a transaction

blockHash.description: BlockHash of the block in which the transaction was mined

blockNumber.description: BlockNumber of the block in which the transaction was mined

data.description: The data/input string sent along with the transaction

logIndex.description: The index of the event within its transaction, null when its pending

schema.description: Whether or not the log was orphaned off the main chain

topic.description: 32 Bytes DATA of indexed log arguments. (In solidity: The first topic is the hash of the signature of the event (e.g. Deposit(address,bytes32,uint256))

transactionHash.description: The hash of the transaction in which the log occurred

transactionIndex.description: The index of the transaction in which the log occurred

Uncle.description: Orphaned blocks that can be included in the chain but at a lower block reward. NOTE: An uncle doesn’t contain individual transactions.

number.description: The block number or null when its the pending block

hash.description: The block hash or null when its the pending block

nonce.description: Randomly selected number to satisfy the proof-of-work or null when its the pending block

sha3Uncles.description: Keccak hash of the uncles data in the block

logsBloom.description: The bloom filter for the logs of the block or null when its the pending block

transactionsRoot.description: The root of the transactions trie of the block.

stateRoot.description: The root of the final state trie of the block

receiptsRoot.description: The root of the receipts trie of the block

miner.description: The address of the beneficiary to whom the mining rewards were given or null when its the pending block

difficulty.description: Integer of the difficulty for this block

totalDifficulty.description: Integer of the total difficulty of the chain until this block

extraData.description: The 'extra data' field of this block

size.description: Integer the size of this block in bytes

gasLimit.description: The maximum gas allowed in this block

gasUsed.description: The total used gas by all transactions in this block

timestamp.description: The unix timestamp for when the block was collated

items.description: Block hash of the RLP encoding of an uncle block

number.description: The block number or null when its the pending block

hash.description: The block hash or null when its the pending block

nonce.description: Randomly selected number to satisfy the proof-of-work or null when its the pending block

sha3Uncles.description: Keccak hash of the uncles data in the block

logsBloom.description: The bloom filter for the logs of the block or null when its the pending block

transactionsRoot.description: The root of the transactions trie of the block.

stateRoot.description: The root of the final state trie of the block

receiptsRoot.description: The root of the receipts trie of the block

miner.description: The address of the beneficiary to whom the mining rewards were given or null when its the pending block

difficulty.description: Integer of the difficulty for this block

totalDifficulty.description: Integer of the total difficulty of the chain until this block

extraData.description: The 'extra data' field of this block

size.description: Integer the size of this block in bytes

gasLimit.description: The maximum gas allowed in this block

gasUsed.description: The total used gas by all transactions in this block

timestamp.description: The unix timestamp for when the block was collated

transactions.description: Array of transaction objects, or 32 Bytes transaction hashes depending on the last given parameter

items.description: Block hash of the RLP encoding of an uncle block

blockHash.description: Hash of the block where this transaction was in. null when its pending

blockNumber.description: Block number where this transaction was in. null when its pending

gas.description: The gas limit provided by the sender in Wei

gasPrice.description: The gas price willing to be paid by the sender in Wei

input.description: The data field sent with the transaction

nonce.description: The total number of prior transactions made by the sender

to.description: address of the receiver. null when its a contract creation transaction

transactionIndex.description: Integer of the transaction's index position in the block. null when its pending

value.description: Value of Ether being transferred in Wei

TransactionHash.description: Keccak 256 Hash of the RLP encoding of a transaction

Keccak.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash

Nonce.description: A number only to be used once

Position.description: Hex representation of the storage slot where the variable exists

DataWord.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data

Bytes.description: Hex representation of a variable length byte array

schema.description: Null value
Integer of the current gas price
A filter used to monitor the blockchain for log/events

fromBlock.description: Block from which to begin filtering events

toBlock.description: Block from which to end filtering events

oneOf.description: Address of the contract from which to monitor events
List of contract addresses from which to monitor events

topics.description: Array of 32 Bytes DATA topics. Topics are order-dependent. Each topic can also be an array of DATA with 'or' options

items.description: Indexable 32 bytes piece of data (made from the event's function signature in solidity)

Logs.name: logs
Logs.description: An array of all logs matching filter with given id.

schema.description: The filter ID for use in `eth_getFilterChanges`
